column2: In a magocracy, aptitude with the great Art of magic is seen as the primary qualification for rulership.
Arcane spellcasters are the majority of the electors, and those with great arcane talents are favoured for election.
In a commonwealth, all free people can vote, in principle. In practice, this power is often wielded for them by professional politicians.
All free citizens are voters, but in practice their votes are readily bought by politicians. Those who control cities have great electoral sway.
Under Divine Mandate, the favour of the gods determines the right to rule. Those who carry the blood of the gods, or are blessed by them with power, will go far.
Clerics wield the most electoral power, as they are seen as the best judges of the gods' blessing.
[From.GetFirstName]'s deeds are the stuff of legend
A man with tattoos is an unfit ruler
Chosen by a ruler possessed by a powerful spirit
Chosen by an admirably ruthless tyrant
[From.GetFirstName] is possessed by a powerful spirit
[From.GetFirstName] has been greatly blessed by Mystra
The title should remain with the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty
[Root.GetFirstName] is a servant of the gods

The Ordning is the strict code of honor, religion, and culture that permeates all true giant societies. Those low on the Ordning are expected to obey those above them, even so far as different breeds of giant.

An ophidian cabal is a loose term grouping the diverse and insidious serpent kingdoms ruled by the Yuan-Ti, Naga or, more rarely, the Sarrukh. Unified by their caste system, the closer an individual is to the ideal snake form, the higher in rank and power they are.
In the wildlands of Faerun, scale-skinned warriors live in loose tribal societies usually controlled by the strongest or most cunning amongst them.
